Case reference: 2014004602.CaseDesc: Denis Gelinas left his home in Notre-Dame-Du-Mont-Carmel on the morning of December 31, 1993 and was never seen again.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Snake and a dagger

Case reference: 2014003136.CaseDesc: Linda Christian Pedersen was last seen at 9:15 a.m. on June 3, 1981 when she left her boyfriend's apartment in Victoria.  She reportedly returned to her own apartment before 11:30 a.m. and spoke to a male acquaintance.  Her whereabouts since that time are unknown.  Linda left behind all valuables and medication.  She was to have met a girlfriend at 4:30 p.m. but failed to show up for the meeting.  She was interested in theatre production and was reportedly meeting an actor during the evening of June 3, 1981.

Hat: Other, Frequently wore a dark-coloured beret

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2018045881.CaseDesc: In July of 2018 Tatianna Cuevas was taken on vacation by her father John Varga from Toronto, Ontario to Paris, France. It is the belief that she was abducted by her father as they have not returned to Canada on the agreed upon date.

Case reference: 2014004010.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1993, Howard Metacat was last seen in Indian Cabins, Alberta. Howard was hunting alone along the Hay River, 6 miles north of Indian Cabins and wandered away from his campsite in the early morning hours of September 17, 1993.

Scar: Neck, 2 inches on the right side

Case reference: 2014001985.CaseDesc: Odette Richard was last seen on February 25, 1990 at approximately 6:30 p.m., when she went for a walk from her home in Laval, Quebec. Odette has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Other, Full, upper and lower dentures
Deformity: Right Foot, Bone bump, top of foot

Case reference: 2006012999.CaseDesc: Joshua Kennet was last seen in the water after the boat he was riding in overturned on Grayson Lake, Ontario on October 13, 1995. Joshua is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2006023699.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Turtle was last seen in Pikangikum in the Squirrel Rock area in Ontario on July 4, 2005. Information received indicated that Mr. Turtle was going to a sand pit area approximately 3 km northwest of Pikangikum.

Hat: Blue, Red, BALL CAP, Red "C", Size Large
Sweater: HOODED, Size XL, Black, Red And White

Case reference: 2013000078.CaseDesc: Candelerio Rodriguez has been missing from Montreal since August 18, 2003 . Mr. Rodriguez might be in the United States.

Case reference: 2014005899.CaseDesc: Karen Gilbert left her home in Quebec City on October 7, 2012, at some point during the night. She was subsequently dropped off by taxi in the vicinity of the Montmorency Falls. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2006012599.CaseDesc: Ralph Grant was last seen in the Huntsville area between January 28 and February 22, 1999. He resided on Yearly Road, Huntsville.

Amputation: Lower jaw surgically removed due to cancer

Case reference: 2015020614.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2015, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Markmiller Kwesiga was seen for the last time near Finch Avenue and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Hat: Grey, Toque, Toque with white lettering on the front
Shoes: Brown, Light brown with black sole

Case reference: 2021001787.CaseDesc: On January 10, 2021, Sébastien Lavallée was seen for the last time when he left his residence. Sébastien had mentioned that he was going to go for a walk on the lake in the ‘MRC des Deux-Montagnes’ in Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Sébastien was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle, and was suffering from mental health problems.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Implant retained dentures, upper and lower

Case reference: 2020040979.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2020, François Danford-Dussault was seen for the last time by his family in Gatineau, Quebec. François is known to be a solitary man who speaks French and English and travels by foot or bicycle. It is believed he may have travelled to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2021057203.CaseDesc: Liam Askin was reported missing by family on December 10, 2021. He was last seen at the east Banff Park gates on November 15, 2020. Liam has significant mental and physical illnesses. There have been no confirmed footprints of life since.

Case reference: 2014004096.CaseDesc: On June 19, 1990, at approximately 4:00pm, Elizabeth Bain was seen for the last time leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Elizabeth was seen leaving in her 1981 Toyota Tercel and was heading to the Scarborough Campus of the University of Toronto. On June 22, her vehicle was found abandon near the University’s campus.

Blouse: Other, BUTTON-UP, Button-up; floral pattern; polyester

Case reference: 2014003039.CaseDesc: Réal Généreux was last seen on October 20, 1980, in Montreal. He was a taxi driver and was known to frequent a tavern on Mont-Royal Street. Following an accident, Réal had difficulty walking due to pain he had in his spine.

Case reference: 2014004565.CaseDesc: On December 1, 2004, Jack Day left Fort McMurray, Alberta, for an unknown destination. On December 4, 2004, Mr. Day's abandoned vehicle was discovered at Chrystina Lake Provincial Recreational area near Swan Hills, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020108.CaseDesc: On March 26, 2006, Tommy Clément-Pépin was seen for the last time at approximately 11:00 a.m., in a hotel in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec. His vehicle was located in a parking lot in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2015044121.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1972, Allen Robert Foy was seen for the last time leaving his home in the Saint-Hubert district of Longueuil, Quebec. Allen Robert said he was travelling on vacation north in the Laurentians to go fishing. He left in his vehicle, a green 1970’s Chrysler Newport which was found 4 or 5 years later, near the Dorval airport in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002498.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1995, Calahan Vandermint was reported missing by his girlfriend when she received a concerning letter from him. Calahan Vandermint was staying at the East Glen Motor Inn in Edmonton, Alberta. He was last seen riding his bike away from the motel on June 6, 1995.

Case reference: 2012020017.CaseDesc: Stephen Begg was reported missing February 16, 2011.  Mr. Begg struggled with alcoholism and depression.

Case reference: 2014001731.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1987, Russell Atkinson was last seen boarding a Greyhound bus in Penticton, British Columbia. The bus was destined for Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Russell did not arrive in Winnipeg but his luggage was found on the bus.

Case reference: 2016032179.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1944, Richard David was seen for the last time riding his bike in front of his family’s home in Etobicoke, Ontario. Later that evening, when Richard’s mother returned home, his bike was found at the house. Richard was a good child at home, and in school, and had no reason to run away.

Socks: Cotton, Grey, Yellow band at top

Case reference: 2014005172.CaseDesc: Debra Marlow was last seen in Kingston Ontario on November 3rd, 2008, where she had a mental health assessment at Kingston General Hospital. She was despondent at that time, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2011001699.CaseDesc: Justin Rutter left home on October 8, 2009 and failed to return.  He is known to frequent Lower Town in Ottawa, Ontario however, has not been seen in that area since that day. Justin may have met with foul play.

Coat: Beige, with white pattern on it
Mark: Right Cheek, 3 moles/freckles in the shape of a triangle

Case reference: 2006011599.CaseDesc: Ervin Bollom was last seen on Obonga Lake, 30 km south of Armstrong, on October 9, 1974.  He had left in his boat to get medical help for an injured friend. His boat was found with the throttle in the "open" position.

Ring: Left Ring Finger, wedding ring - E.B. engraved on the inside
Tattoo: Left Arm, red rose with green stem and the text "true love"

Case reference: 2014002878.CaseDesc: On February 26, 2001, Albert Fare was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Albert was despondent.

Scar: Neck, Surgical; back of the neck

Case reference: 2014001528.CaseDesc: On June 17, 1983, Herbert Keam stayed over at a friends house in Poplar River. Herbert asked his friend to walk with him to Norway House. His friend said no, but they walked together to Herbert's sister's house where they parted ways. Mr. Keam's sister indicated she saw Herbert that morning. He changed his clothing and left the residence without indicating what his plans were. Mr.Keam was reported missing on June 20, by his sister. Police later determined that Herbert was attempting to walk (112km's) to Norway House through the bush, however he started out in the wrong direction. The ground search utilized a police dog and various articles of clothing belonging to Herbert were found. The weather at this time was hot and muggy. Mr. Keam has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020120.CaseDesc: On October 19th 2003, Jeanne-D'Arc Asselin, 66, was to go to her boyfriend's but called to cancel at the last minute. Ms Asselin went to buy beer at the convenience store and was never seen again. She disappeared from Valleyfield. During the months prior to her disappearance, she seemed confused and had memory loss. Ms Asselin had suffered a stroke in the past.

Case reference: 2014006326.CaseDesc: Ronald Kay was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on November 26, 2013. He was last seen at the Saskatchewan Rough Riders Football game and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001355.CaseDesc: Mr. Aurèle Massey was last seen on August 8, 1983 in Montreal. He left his residence to have his vehicle repaired, but never returned. Mr. Massey was despondent and had mentioned that he wanted to jump into the Soulanges Canal.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Straight, Dyed, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2017004343.CaseDesc: Mr. Landry Ntwari travelled to Niagara Falls on January 9, 2017, for a birthday celebration. He was a registered hotel guest staying at a downtown hotel. Since January 10th, there has been no further contact or no known sighting.

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2017068602.CaseDesc: On August 13, 2017, Martin Bertram McLearn was seen for the last time. He has moderate dementia and was reported missing from his home.

Boots: Rubber, Size 7; old, worn and cracked

Case reference: 2020011788.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1982, Ian Shim was seen for the last time when he checked into the Gran Hotel in Pereira, Columbia. Ian, a resident of Toronto, Ontario, was on vacation in Colombia. Shortly after checking in, Ian had gone for a hike, but never returned to his room to collect his personal belongings.

Case reference: 2006006499.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1972, Clifford Boyle was aboard the S.S. Gleneagle on which he was employed. He was last seen on the deck of the left side of the ship near the back.  It is presumed that Mr. Boyle fell overboard and is presumed drowned in Georgian Bay, Ontario.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, End of finger missing

Case reference: 2012020104.CaseDesc: On Saturday, April 15, 2006, Francis Albert-Cloutier was seen for the last time at his home located in Saint-Marc-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. His vehicle, a black 2001 Chrysler Intrepid was found on the following day by a passerby on an ATV trail in Saint-Amable, Quebec. No one has since seen or heard from Francis.

Jewelry: Gold, A ring with colored stone on each middle finger

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2018063007.CaseDesc: On November 18, 1998, Anne Smythe was seen for the last time by her daughter, in Toronto, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Anne was headed in the direction of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006019899.CaseDesc: Frank Uncapher was last seen on Lac Seul on October 21, 1974. He was on a hunting trip.

Case reference: 2006021799.CaseDesc: Leo Payash, aged 8, was last seen on July 01, 1957. He and his mother Cecilia Payash, aged 48 years, were walking on Red Lake Road and neither has been seen since.

Deformity: Nose, Described as having a "hooked" nose

Case reference: 2012020651.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1984, Patricia Favel was seen for the last time in the downtown area of Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014004535.CaseDesc: Jack Fraser was last seen on August 2, 2004 at his place of work in downtown Vancouver. His parents reported him missing as they had not seen or heard from him in over two weeks. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004801.CaseDesc: Beant Singh Khosa was last seen in Punjab, India on April 15th, 2006.  He travelled to India to attend his father's funeral and never returned.  It is rumored he has returned to Canada, however, his family and friends have not heard from him.

Case reference: 2006024599.CaseDesc: Chester Sawyers was last seen outside of a camp in Lochalsh (Riggs Township), Ontario on June 8, 1990.  It was reported that he was upset and indicated that he was heading home. It was believed that Mr. Sawyers left on foot and he has not been seen since.

Wallet: Brown, MasterCard, Canadian Tire Card, a driver's license

Case reference: 2017010385.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2015, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Fadi Zakir was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000071.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1993, Jean-Jacques Cantin was seen for the last time in the Ahuntsic district of Montreal, Quebec. His mother went to his apartment where she found packages that were prepared for different people. His personal belongings and clothes had disappeared.

Case reference: 2013000045.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1963, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Noreen Greenly was seen for the last time leaving her friend’s house. Noreen had told her friend that she was going to wait for the bus at the bus stop across the street. The bus driver was interviewed and he stated that he did not pick her up. A witness had reported seeing a young girl get into a small blue car, and sit close to the driver at approximately the same time and location. The car was described as a 1957 to 1959 Ford Perfect which was in good condition.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Blue, A thin necklace with blue pendant
Purse: Dark Blue, dome fastener, change purse with $0.70 inside
Scar: Right Knee, Center of knee cap

Case reference: 2012020052.CaseDesc: Marilyn Byskal went missing on June 20, 1974, while on a school organized canoe trip. She was last seen at her tent when everyone first woke up in the morning. Most present at the camp felt that Miss Byskal fell into the fast flowing waters of the Grass River, however no one witnessed this. An extensive 10 day water and ground search was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2009005399.CaseDesc: Brian Henry was last seen in North Bay, Ontario on May 5, 1974, at approximately 3:00pm. On that day, his father drove him to Canadore College, so he could walk the nature trails.

Hat: Black, Cowboy or scout type hat
Jacket: May have been wearing a green work jacket
May have been wearing a dark blue work jacket
Denim, Blue, "Coca Cola" logo on left pocket
Watch: Black, With a large black strap, glowed in the dark

Case reference: 2014004389.CaseDesc: On October 23, 2003, Bertha Melvin, who was residing in a group home, left a note advising she was going to the hospital; however she failed to show up.  Ms. Melvin is described a being very introverted and may have been frequenting the rural areas of Waterways in Fort McMurray, AB.

Case reference: 2014002595.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1997, John Grabluk was seen for the last time at the Scarborough Postal Union Office in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, John had taken a leave of absence.

Case reference: 1999000140.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1993, Mary Nancy Goodfellow left home in the company of her grandson Kevin James Charles. Nothing has been heard from them since.

Scar: Forehead, scar on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2006007099.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Erwyn Lippett and his friend, Kirk Weidmann, left the Brucedale conservation area to go for a canoe ride on Lake Huron, near Port Elgin, Ontario. Two life-jackets and two paddles were recovered in the water. Neither man has been seen since.

Mark: Forehead, Large mole on forehead at receding hairline

Tattoo: Right Arm, Boot Hill with cross
Chest, clouds with name Simon and Victoria

Case reference: 2014006290.CaseDesc: Roxanne Marie Isadore was reported missing by a family member on September 24, 2013.  She had been out of family contact since she moved to Edmonton from Valleyview in 2006. Her last confirmed whereabouts were in Edmonton, in June of 2008.  She was known to live in the area of, and to frequent, 118 Ave in the Beverly neighbourhood of Edmonton, AB.

Case reference: 2018054598.CaseDesc: On September 22nd, 2018, Dwayne Lavallee was seen for the last time in his vehicle leaving the Ebb and Flow First Nation community and the vehicle was located on September 26th, north of the community of Ste. Rose du Lac, Manitoba.

Jacket: Black, Yellow, Work jacket with reflective stripes

Case reference: 2014005219.CaseDesc: Lori Lee Berens was last seen January 15, 1985 in the Winnipeg area. Lori has not made contact with her family since then and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Often wore a ponytail

Case reference: 2008007698.CaseDesc: John McColl left a note at his parent's home on January 27, 1979 stating that he was travelling to Nassau, Bahamas via the United States. He is known to have visited with friends in London, Ontario at the beginning of December, 1979.  Also, he purchased an airline ticket on December 14, 1979 in San Francisco. Family had noted that Mr. McColl was depressed at the time.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Middle Finger, previous break from injury/trauma

Case reference: 2014004969.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1966, a friend asked Ronnie Harper to help him lift one of his nets out of the waters of Red Sucker Lake. The two men set off in a canoe. When they arrived at the site, the men pulled the line attached to the net, but it didn't move. Increasing their efforts, the men pulled harder and the line attached to the weight came loose. The sudden shift caused both men to lose their footing and the canoe to overturn. The men attempted to move closer to shore by pushing the canoe. After a time, Mr. Harper told his friend he was too tired to hold on any longer. His companion continued moving the canoe. The survivor then realized Mr. Harper was no longer hanging on. Efforts to locate Mr. Harper were unsuccessful and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2018070318.CaseDesc: In the summer of 1983, Angela Hartmann left home to travel to Ottawa, Thunder Bay, and Calgary before attending fall classes at Trent University in Peterborough, Ontario. It is believed that Angela's last known location was in August of 1983 in Ottawa, Ontario at the Ottawa Youth Hostel.

Case reference: 2012020130.CaseDesc:
Mario Marabella, 40 years old, was on his way to a meeting when he was abducted on December 4, 2008 in Laval, Quebec.  Mario was at a Petro-Canada service station on Highway 440 between highways 19 and 25 around 4:00 p.m. when three people forced him into a van and fled. 

Mario's car, a grey Acura MDX, was retrieved around 8:00 p.m. that evening by one or more of the abductors at the same Petro-Canada station from which he was abducted. A few hours later the car was found burning at the corner of Gouin Boulevard and Lambert St. in Montréal, Quebec.  Mario was linked to the Italian Mafia and was known to be involved in organized crime.

Deformity: Abdomen, excess skin due to weigh lost
Scar: Abdomen, operation on abdomen for weight loss

Case reference: 2014001487.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Raymond Snakeskin was last seen in Wollaston Lake, Saskatchewan. He had told another individual that he was making a pilgrimage to Zangeza Bay on Reindeer Lake, Saskatchewan, approximately 60 kilometers through the bush. Raymond has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2014002360.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1996, Benoit Lachance was seen for the last time in the Pointes-Aux-Trembles District in Montreal, Quebec. Benoit was a member of a motorcycle club called the "Rowdy Crew" and drove a blue Chevrolet Camaro.

Scar: Middle Back, Bullet still in the back

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2012020011.CaseDesc: Daniel Richard McCallum was living in the Lillooet, BC area up until October 2008.  When his family hadn't heard from him for some time, they reported him missing. There are unconfirmed reports that he may have moved away, but police have been unable to determine his whereabouts. His disappearance is considered suspicious.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, scorpio sign with "Dan" written inside

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2014004882.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2003, at approximately 10:00 am, Feng Lin was seen for the last time after he parked his car at 295 Ossington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Shoulders, Two on the upper left

Case reference: 1996004360.CaseDesc: Nina Akbarian may be in the company of her father, Naser Akbarian.

Case reference: 2012020109.CaseDesc: David Fortin was last seen while waiting for the school bus on the morning of February 10, 2009, in Alma, Québec. He was to take the school bus at approximately 7:50 am to get to the Camille Lavoie High School in Alma. However, he never got onto the bus and did not report to school. According to his family, David was a victim of bullying and intimidation at school for several years.

Case reference: 2009002399.CaseDesc: On Friday, April 21, 1972, Francis Harris went to a medical appointment with her husband in Peterborough. On the way home to Apsley, they stopped in Lakefield and she may have gone to the post office and the bank. They arrived home around 11:00 a.m. and ate lunch. Her husband went to work from approximately 1:00 p.m. to 5:05 p.m.  When their son returned home from school at about 3:40 p.m., Mrs. Harris was not home.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Wavy, may have been dyed black
Ring: White gold engagement and wedding ring

Case reference: 2017018201.CaseDesc: Happy Charles, 42 years old, was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan, the evening of April 3rd, 2017. Happy was in frequent contact with her family in La Ronge, Saskatchewan, and had plans to seek treatment for drug addiction.

Jacket: Leather, Black, worn under long wool coat
Black, long wool coat worn over leather jacket
Jewelry: Grey, small silver locket with a picture of son
Pants: Denim, Blue, wears jeans under sweatpants
Purse: light in color with long straps

Case reference: 2006008199.CaseDesc: Harley Metherel telephoned home from Vancouver on December 24, 1980, requesting a money transfer. Money was sent to him, but he never picked it up, and he has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2014041668.CaseDesc: Lise Fredette was last seen leaving work in the city of Peterborough on the evening of November 12, 2014. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Mrs. Fredette, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2014004517.CaseDesc: Edmee (Eva) Mitchell, 83 years old, went missing on August 20, 2004. Mrs. Mitchell was last seen at her rural residence near Kelly Lake, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2022036931.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2022, Keith Zajac was seen for the last time in Brandon, Manitoba. During the time of his disappearance, Keith was traveling from Squamish, British Columbia to Ontario. That same day, his vehicle was located near Highway 1, approximately 10 kilometers west of Brandon. Several witnesses reported seeing Keith walking along the highway, westbound on the Assiniboine River's edge.

Hair: Blonde, Other, Hair shaved to one quarter; blonde, greying
Teeth: Left upper inciser broken and looks smaller

Case reference: 2008007599.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1978, Hugh Bain and three others were participating in the Oshawa Clipper Race from Oshawa, Ontario to Olcott, New York and back to Oshawa. Mr. Bain took his turn to operate the 24 foot boat. A large wave hit the boat and broke over it. The movement of the boat and the wave breaking over the boat sent him over the port side into Lake Ontario.  Mr. Bain has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2018067156.CaseDesc: On November 27, 2018, Courtney James was seen for the last time on security camera footage in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021045206.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2021, Mark Dolan was last seen by his family when he was dropped off at a bus terminal in Brantford, Ontario. His last banking transaction was captured on video at 294 Louisa Street in Parry Sound, Ontario, on October 28, 2021.

Luggage: Other, Multi coloured hiking style backpack.

Case reference: 2015050774.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2015, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Mazen Malik was last seen in the Sheppard Avenue West and Allen Road area in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010002599.CaseDesc: On the morning of Monday, July 19, 2010, Curtis Barry left his residence on Britannia Avenue in Bradford, to walk his two dogs. He was reported missing when his wife returned home in the late afternoon and discovered he was not home. The dogs were located later the same day wandering the streets approximately 1 km from his residence. Mr. Barry has not been seen since and the dog leash has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, a ship and names Lauren, John and Cliff on boat
Torso (Back), 3 roses with names of Michelle, Kietan and Kayla

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2015011664.CaseDesc: On July 6, 1994, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 25-35 was found in the waters of the St. Lawrence River near the Old Port of Montreal Clock Tower in Montreal, Quebec.

Sweater: Cotton, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Fruit of the Loom brand, T-shirt with short sleeves, faded, size medium
Scar: Right Hand, 2.4 cm at the base of the thumb

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2023011363.CaseDesc: Isabella (Rui) Dan was last seen around 8 p.m. on March 3, 2023. According to a witness, it is alleged she asked for a ride to an intersection thought to be in the Town of Markham, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005708.CaseDesc: On October 9, 1959, Martin Kenny and his cousin rode an Algoma Central Railway freight train from Sault Ste. Marie to Hawk Junction, Ontario, to visit his parents. The train came to a stop in Eton at Mile 120, leaving the train car they were riding in behind. Martin failed to reboard the train and was left behind. Martin was last seen in Perry, Ontario, on October 10, 1959. He stopped for water before walking north along the railroad tracks. He was never seen again.

Case reference: 2006008099.CaseDesc: Wilbert James Coulter's abandoned pick-up truck was located on December 28, 1990 on an old snowmobile trail in the Bancroft, Ontario area.  Search of the area failed to locate Mr. Coulter.
